text: Amylocystis is a genus of two species of fungi in the family Fomitopsidaceae. The genus was described in 1944 by mycologists Appollinaris Semenovich Bondartsev and Rolf Singer to contain the type, and at that time, sole species, A. lapponicus. A. unicolor was transferred to the genus (from Tyromyces) in 2003. The generic name Amylocystis is derived from the Ancient Greek words ("starch") and ("bladder"). ==References== Category:Fomitopsidaceae Category:Polyporales genera Category:Taxa named by Rolf Singer Category:Fungi described in 1944
title: Amylocystis
